title: EP0008 Hamarikyu
fullTitle: Hamarikyu Gardens - A Daimyo Garden in the Snow, Tokyo

en: Hamarikyu Onshi Teien is a daimyo garden that was laid out in the Edo period as a villa of the Tokugawa shogunal family. The vast grounds still hold the Nakajima teahouse, used for the shogun's entertainment, and duck hunting grounds that convey the hunting culture of the time—evoking Edo aesthetics and the atmosphere of daily life. After the Meiji period it served as an imperial detached palace; today it is a metropolitan garden marking quiet time.

Snow rarely accumulates in Tokyo, but on a morning after a fall the sight of pines and stone bridges edged in white is exceptional. The snowscape spreading against the backdrop of high-rises vividly captures the moment when Edo and the present overlap. The shoot was so cold that my fingertips went numb and my breath showed white. Even so, that chill was an essential part of capturing this garden's dignified beauty.
ja: 浜離宮恩賜庭園は、江戸時代に徳川将軍家の別邸として整えられた大名庭園である。広大な敷地には、将軍の饗応に用いられた中島の御茶屋や、当時の狩猟文化を今に伝える鴨場が残り、江戸の美意識と暮らしの気配を感じさせる。明治以降は皇室の離宮を経て、現在は都立庭園として静かな時間を刻んでいる。
東京で雪が積もる日はまれだが、降雪の朝、松や石橋が白く縁取られる光景は格別だ。高層ビル群を背景に広がる雪景色は、江戸と現代が重なる瞬間を鮮やかに切り取る。撮影は指先がかじかむほど寒く、吐く息が白い。それでも、その冷え込みさえも、この庭の凛とした美しさを写し取るための大切な一部なのだ。
